intro: Matthiola glabrata, commonly known as the smooth wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, bright yellow, and appear in clusters, blooming from spring to early summer. Matthiola glabrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in well-drained soils with full sun exposure.
